units.title: Lentiviral delivery of inducible Cre and dual sgRNA cassette
units.text: we engiof ARID1B. Specifically, perturbing ARID1B expands ventral radial glia neered a lentiviral vector to deliver 4-hydroxytamoxifen-inducible CRE recombinase and a dual single-guide RNA (sgRNA) cassette (Fig. 1a).
units.rationale: Describes the construction and delivery of the vector used for CRISPR perturbations.

units.title: Cloning and pooling of sgRNA pairs into a lentiviral plasmid library
units.text: We individually cloned sgRNA pairs and pooled them equally to construct a lentiviral plasmid library (Extended Data Fig. 3a,b).
units.rationale: Specifies how sgRNA pairs are prepared for high‑throughput screening.

units.title: Limiting lentiviral integration to one per cell
units.text: To ensure that lentiviral integration frequency was limited to one per cell, we used a low infection rate of 2.5% (ref. 18) (Extended Data Fig. 3c–e).
units.rationale: Ensures single‑clone labeling for accurate clonal analysis.

units.title: Induction of eCas9 in early organoid development
units.text: eCas9 was induced in 5-day-old embryoid bodies, followed by neural induction.
units.rationale: Defines the timing of CRISPR activation in the organoid protocol.

units.title: Flow cytometry‑based gRNA reporter assay
units.text: In this assay, a pre‑assembled array of gRNA‑targeting sequences fused with TagBFP is used to generate interneurons with lateral ganglionic eminence (LGE) origin (LGE‑IN; MEIS2) or caudal ganglionic eminence (CGE) origin (CGE‑IN; NR2F2)28.
units.rationale: Provides a quantitative method to assess sgRNA editing efficiency.

units.title: Quantification of genome‑editing efficiency via BFP loss
units.text: Successful genome editing causes frameshift mutations, resulting in the loss of blue fluorescent protein (BFP) fluorescence, which enables the quantitative evaluation of gRNA efficiency (Fig. 1c and Extended Data Fig. 1b,c).
units.rationale: Describes the readout used to measure editing success.

units.title: Introduction of a unique clone barcode (UCB)
units.text: we introduced a unique clone barcode (UCB; 1.4 × 10^7 combinations) for each dual sgRNA cassette to label individual lentiviral integration events (Fig. 1a and Extended Data Fig. 4a,b).
units.rationale: Allows tracking of individual perturbations across the organoid population.

units.title: Bulk DNA extraction for clonal representation
units.text: Using this strategy, we obtained an average of 2,770 bulk‑extracted genomic DNA from organoid pools of four different unique clones for each perturbation, which we used to generate mosaic batches (Extended Data Fig. 7a).
units.rationale: Generates material for downstream sequencing of clonal composition.

units.title: Annotation of cell clusters using control and uninduced cells
units.text: We first annotated cell clusters based on control cells (non‑targeting gRNA control) and eCas9‑uninduced cells (35,203 cells) (Extended Data Fig. 6d–f).
units.rationale: Establishes reference cell populations for comparative analysis.

units.title: Label transfer to assign cell‑type identities in the CHOOSE dataset
units.text: Cell‑type labels for the full CHOOSE dataset (49,754 cells) were then derived through a label transfer.
units.rationale: Maps identified clusters to known neuronal and progenitor cell types.
